meanings.definition: Written in an excessively elaborate or overdone manner.
meanings.sent1: The story was so overwritten with unnecessary details that it became hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: Her handwriting was neat and simple, not at all overwritten like some of the other students' work.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated with an overwritten amount of frosting, making it look more like a snowball than a dessert.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with flowers, each one more overwritten and colorful than the last.
meanings.sent5: The room was decorated in an overwritten style, with every inch covered in intricate patterns and designs.

meanings.definition: To write over or on top of existing text or data.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally overwritten her essay with new information, losing all her original work.
meanings.sent2: The professor had to use correction fluid to fix the overwritten section of the document.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly overwritten his friend's name on the birthday card with his own, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist skillfully overwritten the old mural with a new, vibrant design.
meanings.sent5: The hacker had maliciously overwritten the company's database, causing chaos and confusion.
